Body:
At a first glance it seems to be obvious/expectable (at least to some extent) that the more frequently a word is used in language the more synonyms it should have.

Can somebody point out whether this has been proved scientifically/statistically and works/publications some data on this?
Title: Connection between word usage frequency and number of synonyms for the word

LastEditedUser.AboutMe:
Travelling armchair linguist.

Never studied in an institution but read books and web with probably more breadth than depth.

Always on the road surviving in a strange foreign language, currently Mongolian and Mandarin Chinese.

And I collect dictionaries.
